sectionText: Prerequisites: ECE 340.  This course explores the energy conversion devices from fundamentals to system-level issues. The modern devices to be explored include light emitting diodes and solar cells. Topics include energy transfer between photons and electron-hole pairs, light emission and capture, emission and absorption engineering via device simulation/design,  radiative and non-radiative  processes in devices, electrical and optical characteristics,  carrier diffusion and mobility, light extraction and trapping, and thermal management for high power high efficiency energy conversion devices.
